column2: Do you consent to participate in this study?
column4: What is your experience with the harmonica?
column5: Have you used music learning or tab-based apps before?
column6: Find a tab titled Amazing Grace and open it.
column7: Show only Medium difficulty tabs and sort them by newest.
column8: Mark any tab as a favourite and show only your favourite tabs.
column9: Create a new tab with a title, key, difficulty, tags, and at least two lines of notes. Save it.
column10: Edit the tab you created, then try to leave without saving.
column11: Start practice mode and move between different lines.
column12: I think that I would like to use this system frequently.
column13: I found the system unnecessarily complex.
column14: I thought the system was easy to use.
column15: I think that I would need the support of a technical person to be able to use this system.
column16: I found the various functions in this system were well integrated.
column17: I thought there was too much inconsistency in this system.
column18: I would imagine that most people would learn to use this system very quickly.
column19: I found the system very cumbersome to use.
column20: I felt very confident using the system.

column22: Do you have any comments or suggestions to improve the app?
column23: Overall, how would you rate the usability of the system?

column22: When entering practice mode, mark notes as button, because i did not know that they can be tapped.
would be nice if the back buttons were at the same place on everz screen, and if the edit screen had a modal asking you if you are sure you want to discard unsaved changes
Everything looks really good, but the onboarding is small but other than that, i love it
